topics.body: I just finished my fifth book of the year "The War of the Jews". As final reflexions I can say that Flavius Josefus was a rat but very well informed about the jewish culture and his time. However, his writing falls under a clear servilism for his patrons. His writing is mediocre since he just transcribed other documents but it can be very informative about the asmonean dynasty of ancient Israel and the war methods of the romans, it also provides an implicit description of the doctrinarian cosmology that defined the jewish mentality. I find detailed description of the very particular military actions of little importance but hey, its culture in the end.
